      <p class="min-height"><b>From the Business:</b>My most treasured childhood memories are from weddings and parties. Having a large extended family in the bay area afforded me many occasions to make those memories. The sheer love &amp; joy (and dancing) at weddings made me wish they would never end. I tried to stay connected to that feeling as I grew up. During college I helped organize DDA (UC Berkeley's Bhangra Competition) and after college I got involved with Vivah (South Asian Bridal Expo) first as a model and later as a producer. My career since then has been full of adventures in marketing for tech companies and supporting CEOs to grow Biotech startups. It's been quite rewarding, but I always felt that something was missing. After planning my wedding and countless events for friends and family over the last 10 years, I'm pursuing my love for events and jumping into the deep entrepreneurial end with this venture. I'm bringing my passion for joy, my experience with organizing large events and logistical skills honed in the corporate world to help you plan and enjoy your life events to the fullest.<span class="more-links" style="display: none;"><a title="Read More about Events By Rubal" href="javascript:void()" onclick="javascript:openFullDescriptionWeb(this)">Read more</a></span></p>

      <p class="min-height"><b>From the Business:</b>Downey Street Events was started by Lauren Geissler and Emily de Ayora, two best friends who met while attending Stanford Law School.  While they both spent much of their time planning events, they didn’t consider turning event planning into a career. Instead their talents manifested themselves in elegant dinner parties, elaborately painted Christmas cookies, fine art and music, and meticulously run fundraisers and campaigns.
In 2008 while working at law firms in the Bay Area, Lauren and Emily planned and designed Lauren’s wedding. They fell in love with the process and saw an opening in the industry for an uber professional high tech event planning firm.  Downey Street Events was born, and booked a full schedule of events within the first several months of business.<span class="more-links" style="display: none;"><a title="Read More about Downey Street Events" href="javascript:void()" onclick="javascript:openFullDescriptionWeb(this)">Read more</a></span></p>

      <p class="min-height"><b>From the Business:</b>Palmdale Estates is proud to be one of the East Bay’s premier wedding industry leaders for over 3 decades. In 1986, Palmdale Estates started its business by managing corporate events at Hidden Valley Ranch and weddings/receptions at the Stanford House in Warm Springs, Fremont. From there, Palmdale Estates went on to host events for 28 years in Mission San Jose, Fremont on the private estate gardens of the Sisters of the Holy Family and in the historic “Best House.” From 2013 - 2017, Palmdale Estates partnered with the Beemiller family to develop Nella Terra Cellars into an exclusive wedding venue on the Beemiller’s one hundred acre private estate in the Sunol hills. Recently, Palmdale Estates opened its newest facility, Casa Bella, in Sunol’s quaint and charming downtown. Casa Bella is a one of a kind venue where modern elegance meets rustic charm. We are now happy to announce Palmdale Estates at Ardenwood Farms in Fremont and our exciting plans to build a mission style venue on the property of the Fremont United Methodist Church. Palmdale Estates has an impressive history of exemplary service that not only sets us apart but has raised industry standards. Whether you are planning a wedding or a special event, Palmdale Estates’ talented team will be there to guide your day. Our friendly tenured staff and highly skilled professional coordinators exude the passion and love for event planning necessary to make your wedding or special event dreams come true.

      <p class="min-height"><b>From the Business:</b>With offices in San Francisco and Los Angeles, Shannon Leahy Rosenbaum of Shannon Leahy Events plans and designs stunning weddings all over the world. Shannon has consistently been named one of the top wedding and event planners in the country.   Shannon has been published in Martha Stewart Weddings, Brides Magazine, The Knot, Modern Luxury Brides, California Wedding Day, Today's Bride as well as numerous blogs including Style Me Pretty, Snippet &amp; Ink and Once Wed.  Shannon is honored to be named one of San Francisco’s top four planners by 7×7 magazine, one of the best wedding planners in the country by Martha Stewart Weddings and is featured in a new book, America's Favorite Wedding Planners: Secrets Revealed.  Shannon has also authored an online course called WED School to teach aspiring wedding professionals the tips of the trade. A Shannon Leahy wedding is characterized by clean line design, a carefully orchestrated flow and an incredible attention to every detail.  She is renowned for her ability to remain calm in stressful situations and is beloved for her candor and creativity.  Clients who come to Shannon for her keen eye for design, her wealth of wedding knowledge and her easygoing nature often become lifelong friends. Shannon feels so blessed to work with people during one of the most joyful times in their lives. She loves to see her Brides glide down the aisle, marking the beginning of the rest of their lives.When she isn’t planning weddings with her fabulous team, she enjoys cooking, skiing, live concerts and hanging out with her husband, Joe, son Guy Brooks and dog, Bodie.<span class="more-links" style="display: none;"><a title="Read More about Shannon Leahy Events" href="javascript:void()" onclick="javascript:openFullDescriptionWeb(this)">Read more</a></span></p>

We take care of all the logistics and work with you to design an event that's beautiful, innovative, and highly personal. Our offices are located in New York, California, and Wyoming and we are available for travel worldwide! As designers, we draw inspiration from the past, present and future, from art, fashion, travel, and the dynamic cities we call home! We love the unstructured organic design as much as clean lines and modern décor, but what we really love is creating a unique combination of these sensibilities in order to produce weddings &amp; events that bring our client’s individual style to the forefront. As planners, our goal is to alleviate the stress and frustration that often accompany wedding &amp; event planning. We deal with all of the scheduling, logistics, paperwork, emails, phone calls and everything in between so you don't have to.       <p class="min-height"><b>From the Business:</b>Tri-Valley celebrates its culture and community through year-round events. This calendar lists live music, yoga in the vineyards, family fun opportunities, and more; there's something here for everyone to love. Use the Tri-Valley's events calendar to plan your next Tri-Venture and create your ideal experience.The Pleasanton Convention &amp; Visitors Bureau (CVB) was originally created as the result of a consultant’s study in 1986, jointly funded by the City of Pleasanton and Pleasanton’s Chamber of Commerce.Initially, the CVB operated under the umbrella of the Chamber but in 1993 it split off entirely from the Chamber as an independent, non-profit agency. In 1996, the City of Livermore was added and the organization became the Tri-Valley Convention &amp; Visitors Bureau. Later that year the City of Dublin joined the CVB, and in 1999, the City of San Ramon joined the four-city bureau, funded by each City’s General Fund.<span class="more-links" style="display: none;"><a title="Read More about Trivalley" href="javascript:void()" onclick="javascript:openFullDescriptionWeb(this)">Read more</a></span></p>
